etymologies: Old English, via Latin from Greek balsamon

definitions: an aromatic resinous substance, such as balm, exuded by various trees and shrubs and used as a base for certain fragrances and medical and cosmetic preparations

examples.text: a mixture of olive oil and balsam
a hair conditioner with protein and balsams

shortDefinitions: aromatic resinous substance, such as balm, exuded by various trees and shrubs and used as base for certain fragrances

definitions: a tree or shrub which yields balsam.
shortDefinitions: tree or shrub which yields balsam

definitions: a herbaceous plant cultivated for its flowers, which are typically pink or purple and carried high on the stem.

notes.text: Genus Impatiens, family Balsaminaceae: several species, including garden balsam (I. balsamina) and Himalayan balsam (I. glandulifera), which is naturalized in Europe and North America, sometimes to the detriment of the native flora

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant cultivated for its helmeted pink or purple flowers
